main event: A witness observed a very bright light in the sky in Gladstone, Michigan on March 8, 1967 for about 15-20 minutes.
interesting points: The object was described as larger than a basketball with glowing colors, including red and green flickering lights beneath it., The object was initially seen descending rapidly, later hovering and exhibiting rising and falling motions., The sighting occurred while watching from indoors at night., The witness's dog alerted them to the object, which moved quickly and then instantaneously disappeared to the northwest., There were no photographs but there was a hand-drawn sketch illustrating the object's path.
witness description: Marcella J. Hartman, a resident of Gladstone, Michigan
